questions.question: What is a 'Rich Client Interface' in Java?
answers: A GUI with minimal interactivity and basic functionality
A GUI that enhances user experience through interactivity, visual appeal, and advanced features
A command-line interface with enhanced text formatting

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a feature of a Rich Client Interface?
Which Java technology was the first to provide a GUI toolkit in 1996?
Which Java GUI toolkit, introduced in 1998, improved platform independence and UI design flexibility over AWT?
What does SWT stand for, and what was its primary advantage?
answers: Standard Widget Toolkit; using native widgets for better performance
Simple Window Toolkit; ease of use

questions.question: When was JavaFX introduced, and what is its primary purpose?
answers: 2008; to address modern UI development needs with rich APIs
1996; as the first Java GUI toolkit

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of JavaFX?
In JavaFX, what is the purpose of the 'Stage' class?
answers: To define the main application window
To create UI controls like buttons and text fields

questions.question: Which method in a JavaFX application is used to set up the primary stage?
What is the function of the JavaFX 'Scene' class?
answers: To contain all content for a specific stage

questions.question: Which layout pane in JavaFX arranges its children in a single vertical column or horizontal row?
What is FXML in JavaFX?
answers: A scripting language for event handling
A declarative XML-based language for defining UI layouts
A language for defining database queries

questions.question: Which of the following features is NOT included in JavaFX?
answers: Built-in UI controls and CSS styling

questions.question: Which component of JavaFX is used for rendering web content within an application?
Which architecture is common to both JavaFX and Android development?
